## GAD-7 vs SPOVI-14

When it comes to psychological surveys and questionnaires, it can often be a complex task to compare different tests and analyses. This is particularly true when attempting to compare two unique instruments, like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Specific Phobia of Vomiting Inventory (SPOVI-14). However, with the Harmony software developed for psychologists, the GAD-7 vs SPOVI-14 comparison becomes simpler, more efficient, and highly accessible. Harmony uses natural language processing and generative AI models to harmonise questionnaire items between different tests. It makes the process of comparing GAD-7 vs SPOVI-14 questionnaires straightforward and less time-consuming. By using Harmony, psychologists can unlock actionable insights and understand the correlation between GAD-7 and SPOVI-14 results more effectively. They can select instruments from Harmony's database or upload their own instruments in PDF form into Harmony's web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app If your research or practice involves the comparison of GAD-7 vs SPOVI-14, Harmony offers an invaluable tool. The software can provide a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and SPOVI-14, allowing professionals to do side-by-side analyses with ease. Furthermore, Harmony boasts multi-language support, solidifying its place as a truly versatile and user-friendly software. Utilize Harmony for your GAD-7 vs SPOVI-14 comparisons and improve the overall quality and efficiency of your psychology research.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SPOVI-14

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SPOVI-14 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SPOVI-14 into Harmony</a> - compare SPOVI-14 with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
